item.title: Crowdstrike 表示正积极与受停电影响的客户合作
item.description: 网络安全公司 Crowdstrike 首席执行官周五表示，该公司正积极与受微软 Windows 主机单个内容更新中发现的缺陷影响的客户合作，与此同时，全球正在发生重大的技术故障。【原文：Cybersecurity firm Crowdstrike is actively working with customers impacted by a defect found in a single content update for Microsoft Windows hosts, the company's CEO said on Friday, amid an ongoing major global tech outage.】

item.title: 因国际钻井需求，SLB 季度利润超出预期
item.description: 周五，由于国际市场对钻井设备和技术的稳定需求，这家顶级油田服务供应商的第二季度利润超过了分析师的预期。【原文：SLB beat analysts' estimates for second-quarter profit on Friday, as the top oilfield services provider benefited from steady demand for its drilling equipment and technology in international markets.】

item.title: 哈里伯顿因国际业务强劲而实现季度利润增长
item.description: 油田服务公司哈里伯顿周五公布季度利润增长，主要得益于国际客户对其钻井设备和服务的稳定需求。【原文：Oilfield services firm Halliburton reported a rise in quarterly profit on Friday, helped by stable demand from international customers for its drilling equipment and services.】

item.title: 解说员：是什么导致了全球网络中断？
item.description: 周五，一场全球性的技术故障中断了多个行业的运营，航班停飞，多家广播公司被迫停播，从银行业到医疗保健系统都受到影响。【原文：A global tech failure disrupted operations across multiple industries on Friday, halting flights and forcing a number of broadcasters off-air, as the outage upended everything from banking to healthcare systems.】

item.title: 通用电气航空航天集团将投资 10 亿美元升级发动机维修车间
item.description: 通用电气航空航天集团（GE Aerospace）周五公布了一项计划，将在五年内投资超过 10 亿美元，用于扩建其全球维护、修理和大修（MRO）设施，并缩短客户的周转时间。【原文：GE Aerospace on Friday unveiled a plan to invest more than $1 billion over five years to expand its maintenance, repair, and overhaul (MRO) facilities worldwide and reduce turnaround times for its customers.】

item.title: 中国石化上半年原油吞吐量仅增长 0.1
item.description: 亚洲最大的炼油企业中国石油化工股份有限公司（中石化）周五公布的上半年原油吞吐量同比变化不大。【原文：China Petroleum and Chemical Corp (Sinopec) , Asia's largest refiner, on Friday reported first-half crude throughput little changed year on year.】

item.title: 科技股溃败，期货下跌，交易员正努力应对全球网络故障
item.description: 周五，美国股指期货下跌，原因是交易商在评估全球技术故障对各行各业造成的影响时，纷纷撤离价格昂贵的大型科技股。【原文：U.S. stock index futures fell on Friday, as traders shifted out of expensive megacap technology stocks, while assessing the impact of a worldwide tech outage that hit businesses across sectors.】

item.title: 大型美国债券经理人远离长期国债
item.description: 一些掌管着数万亿美元资产的公司的美国债券经理们正在避开长期美国政府债券，因为他们预计财政忧虑会刺激周期性的波动。【原文：A number of U.S. bond managers at firms in charge of trillions of dollars of assets are steering clear of long-term U.S. government bonds as they expect fiscal worries to spur periodic bouts of volatility.】

item.title: 早间竞价：波动性卷土重来，技术故障令人不安
item.description: Mike Dolan 展望美国和全球市场的未来一天【原文：A look at the day ahead in U.S. and global markets from Mike Dolan】

item.title: 华尔街一周前瞻 投资者指望盈利平息 9000 亿美元的美国科技股颓势
item.description: 随着财报季的全面展开，看涨的投资者希望稳健的公司业绩将阻止科技股的暴跌，而科技股的暴跌已经冷却了今年美股的涨势。【原文：As earnings season goes into full swing, bullish investors hope solid corporate results will stem a tumble in technology shares that has cooled this year’s U.S. stock rally.】

item.title: Capital One 与社区团体将就 Discover 交易举行公开会议，一决高下
item.description: Capital One 首席执行官理查德-费尔班克（Richard Fairbank）和其他高管将在周五由监管机构召开的公开会议上与社区团体正面交锋，讨论该银行与发现金融服务公司（Discover Financial Services）的合作事宜。【原文：Capital One's chief executive Richard Fairbank and other executives will go head-to-head with community groups at a public meeting on Friday convened by regulators to discuss the bank's tie-up with Discover Financial Services .】

item.title: 美联储在决定夏季末降息前将面临一波数据浪潮
item.description: 美联储主席杰罗姆-鲍威尔（Jerome Powell）曾表示，美联储将在 9 月 17 日至 18 日的会议上开始降息，这将代表着政策的 "重大 "改变，即从大流行病时期的抗通胀斗争转向宽松货币政策阶段。【原文：Investors have locked onto the U.S. central bank's Sept. 17-18 meeting for the start of interest rate cuts that Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell has said will represent a "consequential" change in policy from the pandemic-era battle against inflation to a phase of easing monetary policy.】

item.title: 零售商提前在美国开展返校销售加速了海运旺季的到来
item.description: 零售商沃尔玛、塔吉特（Target）和希恩（Shein）提前启动了返校销售，以阻止亚马逊公司（Amazon.com）的 "Prime Day "活动蚕食美国的背包和笔记本电脑销售，从而将海运旺季提前了两个月，并推高了本已高企的运费。【原文：Retailers Walmart , Target and Shein kicked off back-to-school sales early to stop Amazon.com's Prime Day event from siphoning U.S. sales of backpacks and laptops, helping advance the peak ocean shipping season by two months and boost already-high freight rates.】

item.title: 贝恩称飞机发动机维修时间创历史新高
item.description: 据咨询公司贝恩（Bain）称，航空公司面临有史以来最长的发动机维修等待时间，维修需求可能在2026年达到峰值，在新飞机同时短缺的情况下，这将制约航空公司的发展并增加成本。【原文：Airlines face their longest ever waits for engine maintenance with demand likely to peak in 2026, according to consultancy Bain, constraining carriers' growth and adding costs amid a concurrent shortfall in new aircraft.】

item.title: 全球技术故障导致全球航班延误和服务中断
item.description: 周五，一场似乎与全球网络安全公司 CrowdStrike 和微软的问题有关的全球性技术故障影响了包括机场、航空公司、媒体和银行在内的多个行业的运营。【原文：A global tech outage that appeared to be related to issues at global cybersecurity firm CrowdStrike and Microsoft was affecting operations in various sectors on Friday including airports, airlines, media and banks.】

item.title: 网络中断导致业务中断，从伦敦到新加坡的交易商陷入困境
item.description: 从伦敦到新加坡的石油、天然气、电力、股票、货币和债券交易商周五都在努力运作，因为全球网络故障阻碍了他们的业务，公司、银行和交易消息人士说。【原文：Traders in oil, gas, power, stocks, currencies and bonds from London to Singapore struggled to operate on Friday as a global cyber outage hampered operations, companies, banks and trading sources said.】

item.title: 澳大利亚法院对违反信用卡规则的美国运通罚款 530 万美元
item.description: 澳大利亚企业监管机构周五表示，澳大利亚联邦法院对美国运通（AmEx）的一家地方机构处以 800 万澳元（536 万美元）的罚款，原因是其两张联名信用卡违反了设计和分销规则。【原文：The Federal Court of Australia fined a local unit of American Express (AmEx) A$8 million ($5.36 million) for breaching design and distribution rules for two of its co-branded credit cards, the Australian corporate regulator said on Friday.】

item.title: 航空旅行受全球网络故障影响
item.description: 由于机场和航空公司陷入大规模的 IT 故障，世界各地的飞机乘客面临延误、取消和办理登机手续的问题，从银行到媒体公司等各行各业也受到影响。【原文：Air passengers around the world faced delays, cancellations and problems checking in as airports and airlines were caught up in a massive IT outage that also affected industries ranging from banks to media companies.】

item.title: 空中客车公司 A321XLR 喷气式客机获得欧洲认证
item.description: 空中客车公司发言人周五表示，该公司单通道喷气机家族的最新成员--远程 A321XLR 已获得欧洲认证。【原文：Airbus has won European certification for the latest addition to its single-aisle family of jets, the long-distance A321XLR, a spokesperson said on Friday.】

item.title: 全球网络瘫痪导致航班停飞，媒体、金融和电信遭受重创
item.description: 美国主要航空公司周五以通信问题为由下令停飞，而全球其他航空公司、媒体公司、银行和电信公司也报告称系统故障正在干扰他们的运营。【原文：Major U.S. airlines ordered ground stops on Friday citing communications issues, while other carriers, media companies, banks and telecoms firms around the world also reported system outages were disrupting their operations.】

item.title: 官员称泰国计划制定新的金融商业法以吸引资金
item.description: 泰国财政部副部长周五表示，泰国正计划出台一部新的金融商业法，以吸引外国资金并促进该行业的投资。【原文：Thailand is planning to introduce a new financial business law to attract foreign funds and facilitate investment in the sector, a deputy finance minister said on Friday.】

item.title: 大宗商品价格下跌拖累欧洲股市下挫
item.description: 受大宗商品价格下降和全球科技股溃败的影响，欧洲股市周五下跌，并将出现单周跌幅，同时投资者还在评估更多最新财报。【原文：European shares fell on Friday and were set for weekly losses, hurt by lower commodity prices and as a rout in global technology shares extended, while investors assessed more earnings updates.】

item.title: 即使经济放缓，中国仍可能维持贷款利率：路透社民意调查
item.description: 路透社的一项民意调查显示，中国预计将在周一维持基准贷款利率不变，而在第二季度经济数据弱于预期之后，更多的市场参与者预计中国将进一步放松银根以刺激经济。【原文：China is expected to leave benchmark lending rates unchanged on Monday, while more market participants project further monetary easing to aid the economy following weaker-than-expected second-quarter economic data, a Reuters poll showed.】

item.title: 通胀重回目标，欧洲央行决策者支持更多降息措施
item.description: 两位欧洲中央银行（ECB）决策者周五支持进一步降息，对明年通胀率将达到欧洲中央银行的目标表示了更大的信心。【原文：Two European Central Bank policymakers on Friday backed further interest rate cuts, expressing greater confidence that inflation was heading to the ECB's goal next year.】

item.title: LSEG 的 Workspace 平台遭遇大面积故障
item.description: LSEG 集团的 Workspace 新闻和数据平台周五发生故障，影响了全球用户的访问。【原文：LSEG Group's Workspace news and data platform suffered an outage on Friday that affected user access worldwide.】

item.title: 英国批准国民福利大厦与维珍钱庄 37.5 亿美元的交易
item.description: 英国竞争监管机构周五表示，已批准全美房屋建筑协会（Nationwide Building Society）拟以 29 亿英镑（37.5 亿美元）全现金收购英国维珍钱庄（Virgin Money UK）的交易。【原文：Britain's competition regulator said on Friday it has cleared Nationwide Building Society's proposed 2.9-billion-pound ($3.75 billion) all-cash deal to buy Virgin Money UK .】

item.title: 美国航空公司因通信问题发布地面停飞，FAA 状态页面显示
item.description: 据美国联邦航空管理局的状态页面显示，由于通信问题，美国大型航空公司美国航空周五早些时候发布了所有航班停飞的消息。【原文：Major U.S. carrier American Airlines issued a ground stop for all its flights early on Friday due to a communication issue, according to the U.S. Federal Aviation Administration's status page.】

item.title: 全球流动的百万富翁威胁因税收问题抛弃英国
item.description: 对于超级富豪企业家巴西姆-海达尔（Bassim Haidar）来说，住在伦敦已经成为一种昂贵的放纵，他再也无法为之辩解。【原文：For ultra-wealthy entrepreneur Bassim Haidar, living in London has become an expensive indulgence he can no longer justify.】

item.title: 英国国家统计局：英国 6 月零售额降幅超预期
item.description: 英国国家统计局（Office for National Statistics）周五表示，英国 6 月份零售销售量的降幅超出预期，在 5 月份大幅增长 2.9% 之后又下降了 1.2%。【原文：British retail sales volumes fell by more than expected in June, dropping by 1.2% after a 2.9% jump in May, the Office for National Statistics said on Friday.】

item.title: 伊莱克斯受美国市场回暖提振，但货运成本增加
item.description: 由于北美业务出现了期待已久的回暖迹象，伊莱克斯在第二季度实现了远高于预期的利润，这使得这家家电制造商的股价在周五短暂大幅走高。【原文：Electrolux swung to a much larger than expected profit in the second quarter amid signs of a long-awaited pick up in its North American business, briefly sending the appliances maker's shares sharply higher on Friday.】
